newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar down on poor demand, fresh arrivals.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar down on poor demand, fresh arrivals.

text.p: Sugar prices extended losses on the local markets on Tuesday, as low consumer demand and fresh arrivals dragged prices downward, dealers said.
In the ready delivery sugar S-30 slid by 5 rupees at 1,250/1,275 rupees per quintal while M-30 fell by 5/15 rupees to 1,285/1,365 rupees per quintal.
"Supplies of the sugar improved today in the market amid fresh offerings by millers," one trader said.
Sugar was down by 7/10 rupees per quintal on Monday. Sugar mill delivery fell to 1,185/1,210 rupees per quintal from 1,200/1,215 rupees as fresh buying petered out, he added.
This prompted unloading by the millers, the trader said.
Sentiment was subdued at the close and reports that the Indian government has permitted export of an additional 250,000 tonnes of sugar failed to cheer market sentiment amid low physical trading.
